chargeHist.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) - As a Party to a Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gifford John Guy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (>5-15G) - As a Party to a Crime [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid within the first year of probation.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

Defendant, Gifford John Guy, appeared.  William P Nemer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised Defendant of his rights, Preliminary Hearing date set, bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.
